name: Chicken and Sun-Dried Tomato Bruschetta
author: SMPETER
summary: This recipe is the definition of versatility - if the weather's mild, use the grill outside to prepare this appetizer. In colder months, use your oven instead. The amount of ingredients for this recipe can be scaled back or multiplied to accommodate any range of party guests. You can also alter the amount of most of the ingredients according to your personal preference. You'll enjoy this variation on regular old bruschetta appetizers!
ingredients: 1 ¼ cups Italian salad dressing, divided
8  sun-dried tomatoes, packed without oil, chopped
1 (1 pound) loaf focaccia bread, cut into 1/2-inch thick slices
directions: Place the chicken and 1 cup salad dressing in a bowl
Cover, and marinate at least 3 hours in the refrigerator
Preheat the grill for high heat
Discard dressing used for marinating, and grill chicken 7 minutes per side, or until juices run clear
In a large bowl, mix the cooked chicken, spinach, feta cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, and remaining dressing
Brush the focaccia bread with olive oil, and cook 1 minute per side on the prepared grill, or until lightly toasted
Place portions of the chicken mixture on the toasted focaccia to serve
